children.subject: Are there any estimates on when applicants will hear back?

history.content:
EECS C106A, Introduction to Robotics, is still hiring readers, lab assistants, and lab TAs (descriptions below)! If you are interested, please fill out this form: https://forms.gle/JdakVEYpSim1Xvoh7 
Readers (8hr) will be responsible for grading and assisting students in understanding material. Their work will revolve around the theory taught in class. We're excited that readers for this course are student-facing and will be able to actively engage with TAs and students. Weekly responsibilities include 1 hour of meeting, 1 hour of assisting HW party/office hours, 2 hours of prep, and 4 hours of grading. After Midterm 2, no further homeworks will be released, and readers will spend their time instead writing creative problems to contribute to future semesters' practice problems, discussions, or even exams!

Lab Assistants (8hr) will be responsible for helping out during lab sections. Their work will be lab-based, so they must be familiar with ROS and comfortable debugging problems. Weekly responsibilities include 1 hour of meeting, 3 hours of prep for upcoming labs, and 4 hours fo assisting in lab (2x 2-hour partial sections). Lab Assistants will also help students debug their final projects and will be asked to assist during lab office hours post-Midterm 2.

Lab TAs (10hr, possible 15hr) are the students' main point-of-contact for all lab related matters. Lab TAs will lead lab sections as well as assist other Lab TAs in their sections. Lab TAs must be comfortable leading their lab section's staff and delegating work to ensure all students are getting help and attention in a timely manner. Lab TAs are responsible for knowing common bugs in each lab and must be comfortable debugging new problems, especially within ROS. Weekly responsibilities include 1 hour of meeting with other TAs/professors, 1 hour of lab office hours, 3 hours of prep, and 5 hours of teaching lab (3 hours leading a lab, 2 hours assisting a partial section).
